0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Surgical procedure on eye proper, (used for staining the anterior capsule of the lens); Adjunct: (cataract surgery): apply 0.5 mL onto the anterior lens capsule using a blunt cannula
  • Vitrectomy, (used for staining the epiretinal membranes); Adjunct: apply 0.15% ophthalmic soln to the retinal membrane using a blunt cannula attached to the provided syringe

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• Surgical procedure on eye proper, (used for staining the anterior capsule of the lens); Adjunct: (cataract surgery): apply 0.5 mL onto the anterior lens capsule using a blunt cannula
  • Vitrectomy, (used for staining the epiretinal membranes); Adjunct: apply 0.15% ophthalmic soln to the retinal membrane using a blunt cannula attached to the provided syringe

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
  • Surgical procedure on eye proper, (used for staining the anterior capsule of the lens); Adjunct
  • Vitrectomy, (used for staining the epiretinal membranes); Adjunct

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: when a non-hydrated, hydrophilic, acrylic intraocular lens is to be inserted into the eye (absorption of the dye by the lens may occur)

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono: excessive staining; following injection, excess dye should be immediately removed from the eye by irrigation of the anterior chamber

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
Ophthalmic:Abnormal color, of high water content hydrogen intraocular lenses, Abnormal color, of the posterior lens capsule and vitreous face, inadvertent

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Trypan blue, a staining agent used in ophthalmic surgery, selectively colors the connective tissue structures in the human eye, such as the anterior lens capsule of the crystalline lens, epiretinal membranes, and internal limiting membranes.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Ophthalmic
  • (MembraneBlue(TM)) prior to injection, fill the entire vitreous cavity with air; alternatively, the vitreous cavity can be filled with a balanced salt solution
  • (MembraneBlue(TM)) apply to the retinal membrane using a blunt cannula without contacting the retina or damaging the retina
  • (MembraneBlue(TM)) following injection, remove all excess dye from the vitreous cavity before replacing the air with fluid
  • (Visionblue(R)) after opening the eye, inject an air bubble into the anterior chamber of the eye to minimize dilution of trypan blue by the aqueous
  • (Visionblue(R)) apply onto anterior of lens capsule using a blunt cannula
  • (Visionblue(R)) following injection, irrigate the anterior chamber with balanced salt solution to remove all excess dye

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono: May cause abnormal coloring of the posterior lens capsule and vitreous face. Advise patient that this is self-limiting and may last up to a week.
